info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 20 at 5:15AM EDT until June 20 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Polk County in western North Carolina... Northern Spartanburg County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 1115 AM EDT. * At 515 AM EDT, 911 call center reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring along Skyuka Creek and surrounding areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management / 911 call center reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus, Landrum, Tryon, Chimney Rock State Park, Mill Spring and Lake Adger. Tributaries of the north Pacolet River including Skyuka Creek are confirmed to be experiencing flash flooding. Multiple roadway closures were reported along Lynn Road from Capps Road to Rippy Road, as well as at the intersection of Silver Creek Road and Garret Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
